channel.title: Portforwading
channel.description: ok ive done ipconfig, and got too my router page. its a netgear router and i dont have a "gaming tab" anyone portforward with a netgear router too? any ideas please?

item.title: Portforwading
item.dc:creator: @oldschoolscape oldschoolscape
item.description:
@oldschoolscape wrote:

[quote=“demon 2242, post:2, topic:261752”]alright i understand everything you said i went through the same exact thing.

  1. connect to ur LAN source if not ready.

  2. openup commands promt type in ipconfig and find ur lan ip

  3. go to ur router page and find port fowarding/port triggering on the left side

  4. once ur there go to add custom services
    for service name put in silabsoft
    keep it on tcp/udp for service type
    for starting and ending pot put in 43594
    and then or server ip adress go pack to step 2 and put in ur LAN ip adress.

  5. Ur Port fowarded!
    id ur useing a laptop and unplug ur LAN cord everonce in a while ur lan ip adresss may change when u unplug it and plug it back in
    all you have to do is go back to step 2 find out what ur LAN change to go back to youre router/portfowarding page and edit the silabsoft portfoward already there and put the port to what it changed to press the apply button and ur there!!!

if you need help or dont understand just message me.![/quote]

thanks you’ve helped alot allthough i have different tabs too you.

 Setup Wizard

Setup
Basic Settings
ADSL Settings
Wireless Settings
Security
Logs
Block Sites
Firewall Rules
Services
Schedule
E-mail
Maintenance
Router Status

Advanced
WAN Setup
Dynamic DNS
LAN IP Setup
Remote Management
Static Routes
UPnP
Advanced - VPN
VPN Wizard
VPN Policies
VPN Status
Web Support
Knowledge Base
Documentation

if i go too security then services, i the same options as you specified above such as

for service name put in silabsoft
keep it on tcp/udp for service type
for starting and ending pot put in 43594
and then or server ip adress go pack to step 2 and put in ur LAN ip adress.

except i dont have server ip. do you mean for the server ip to go in server files or is this somehwre on the router page ?

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwading
item.dc:creator: @demon_2242 demon 2242
item.description:
@demon_2242 wrote:

alright i understand everything you said i went through the same exact thing.

  1. connect to ur LAN source if not ready.

  2. openup commands promt type in ipconfig and find ur lan ip

  3. go to ur router page and find port fowarding/port triggering on the left side

  4. once ur there go to add custom services
    for service name put in silabsoft
    keep it on tcp/udp for service type
    for starting and ending pot put in 43594
    and then or server ip adress go pack to step 2 and put in ur LAN ip adress.

  5. Ur Port fowarded!
    id ur useing a laptop and unplug ur LAN cord everonce in a while ur lan ip adresss may change when u unplug it and plug it back in
    all you have to do is go back to step 2 find out what ur LAN change to go back to youre router/portfowarding page and edit the silabsoft portfoward already there and put the port to what it changed to press the apply button and ur there!!!

if you need help or dont understand just message me.!

Read full topic
